groups.name: AVP Britain (Alternatives to Violence Project)
groups.desc: Workshops for anyone who wants to find ways of resolving conflict without resorting to violence. Low cost places available.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: Anxiety UK
groups.desc: Information and support for people with anxiety disorders including 1:1 therapy info.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: Benzo Buddies
groups.desc: Benzodiazepine mutual support forum and information for those withdrawing and recovering from benzodiazepine use.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: No More Panic
groups.desc: Information for sufferers and carers of people with Panic, Anxiety, Phobias and OCD, including Message Forum and Chat room.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: No Panic
groups.desc: Information, advice & telephone mentoring for people (and carers) with Panic, Anxiety, Phobias, OCD and the effects of tranquiliser withdrawal. Plusaudio and phone (01952 680835) recording of the Breathing Technique.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: OCD-UK
groups.desc: Information and advice for people affected by OCD (and their family/friends), including advice line, blogs, publications, advice on seeking therapy and support group information.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: OCD Action
groups.desc: Support, information and advocacy to anyone affected by OCD, including local and online support groups.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: Social Anxiety UK
groups.desc: Volunteer led forum and chat rooms for those with social anxiety.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.name: Triumph Over Phobia (TOP UK)
groups.desc: Information and network of self-help groups for people with phobias, OCD and other related anxiety difficulties.

groups.name: Child Death Helpline
groups.desc: Helpline for anyone affected by the death of a child of any age. Advice, information, listening, befriending, referrals and face to face service by arrangement.

groups.name: The Compassionate Friends
groups.desc: Helpline and support services for bereaved parents, siblings and grandparents after the death of a child of any age and any cause.

groups.name: Cruse Bereavement Care Helpline
groups.desc: One to one, group and email support for people at any time along the bereavement journey - however, wherever and whenever your loved one died.

groups.name: Survivors of Bereavement by Suicide
groups.desc: Helpline and other support services run by a self-help group for people bereaved by suicide. Monthly group meetings in various locations.

groups.name: Bipolar UK
groups.desc: Information, on-line community, Peer Support line and a network of self help groups for people affected by bipolar disorder.

groups.name: Bullying UK
groups.desc: Part of Family Lives Project, providing forums, advice and information about staying safe and how to deal with cyber bullying.

groups.name: Bully Online
groups.desc: Information for anyone being bullied at work plus support and discussion forum.

groups.name: Awareness Centre (Clapham, SW4 and Tooting, SW17)
groups.desc: Low cost counselling and psychotherapy via self-referral, £20 a session for those on benefits / £35 for those on a low income.

groups.name: British Association for Counselling & Psychotherapy (BACP)
groups.desc: Accreditation organisation for counselling and psychotherapy, with national directory of counsellors on their website, some of who offer low cost therapy.

groups.name: Centre 70 Counselling (London, SE27)
groups.desc: Low cost counselling service dealing with a range of problems with online self-referral. Fees on a sliding scale, with some free places.

groups.name: Guild of Psychotherapists Psychotherapy Clinic (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Low cost psychoanalytic psychotherapy service for people on income of less that £18,000, via self referral to reduced fee clinic.

groups.name: Lewisham Psychological Therapies Service (IAPT)
groups.desc: CBT for anxiety (panic, social anxiety OCD etc) and depression and counselling for other difficulties. Self, online and GP referral – free NHS service.

groups.name: Multi Ethnic Service, Waterloo Community Counselling (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Free service for those that require counselling in other languages, and to refugees and asylum seekers living in any South London borough. Self-referral via Lambeth IAPT calling 020 3228 6747.

groups.name: Waterloo Community Counselling (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Low cost counselling service for a range of problems via self-referral. Fees on a sliding scale.

groups.name: Westminster Pastoral Foundation WPF (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Individual CBT, psychodynamic, psychoanalytic and group therapy. Fees according to income bands (minimum £40 per session for long term therapy).

groups.name: APNI (Association for Post Natal Illness)
groups.desc: Support to mothers suffering from post-natal illness via phone and webchat.

groups.name: CALM (Campaign Against Living Miserably)
groups.desc: Helpline, information and webchat for men at risk of suicide or wishing to talk.

groups.name: Papyrus
groups.desc: Website and helpline supporting people under 35 at risk of suicide.

groups.name: First Person Plural
groups.desc: Information for people affected by complex Dissociative Identity Disorders (DID).

groups.name: PODS
groups.desc: Helpline, information and support service, including Find a Therapist and peer support forum for people with DID.

groups.name: Asha Project
groups.desc: Information, advice and refuge for South Asian women (age 18+) and their children experiencing domestic violence.

groups.name: Domestic Violence Helpline
groups.desc: 24 hour national domestic violence helpline, plus information and resources, run by Refuge and Women’s Aid for women experiencing domestic violence, their family, friends, colleagues and others calling on their behalf.

groups.name: Domestic Violence Intervention Project (DVIP)
groups.desc: For male perpetrators, their female partners and children. A range of services including violence prevention group programme with fees on a sliding scale or free via Social Services.

groups.name: Everyman Project
groups.desc: Arange of support services for men who want to stop behaving violently or abusively, and for the people affected by their violence or abuse. These include a focused brief counselling programme, a partner support programme, providing information and advice on the telephone.

groups.name: Gaia Centre
groups.desc: Support services for those living in the London borough of Lambeth who are experiencing gender-based violence (Women aged 13 and over, and men aged 16 or over).

groups.name: Holes in the Wall (Parent Abuse)
groups.desc: Blog site with information, event details and resources about parent abuse (child to parent violence).

groups.name: Men’s Advice Line
groups.desc: A confidential helpline and webchat for any man experiencing domestic violence and abuse from a partner (or ex-partner).

groups.name: Refuge
groups.desc: Refuges, independent advocacy, community outreach and culturally specific services

groups.name: Respect Helpline
groups.desc: Helpline for anyone concerned about their own or someone else’s behaviour towards their partner (male, female, in heterosexual or same-sex relationships).

groups.name: Solace Women’s Aid
groups.desc: Advice, advocacy, counselling, children/young people and families service and refuges for women who have experienced domestic and sexual violence.

groups.name: Women’s Aid
groups.desc: Advice, contacts and Survivors Forum.

groups.name: ABA (Anorexia and Bulimics Anonymous)
groups.desc: 12 step programme for anorexia and bulimia. London meetings and virtual meetings.

groups.name: ABC (Anorexia and Bulimia Care)
groups.desc: Care, emotional support and practical guidance for anyone affected by eating disorders, via helpline, befriending and family support.

groups.name: BEAT
groups.desc: Information, helpline and range of online support groups.

groups.name: Adfam
groups.desc: Information, including local support groups and helpline finder for anyone affected by someone else’s substance use.

groups.name: Al-Anon / Al-Ateen
groups.desc: 12 step Fellowship peer support groups for anyone whose life is, or has been, affected by someone else’s drinking.

groups.name: Carers UK
groups.desc: Advice, information and support for carers, including groups and online forum.

groups.name: DrugFam
groups.desc: Helpline for any family member affected or bereaved by a loved one’s substance use.

groups.name: Family Lives
groups.desc: Helpline, e-mail and online support for a range of family issues including parenting with an online parenting course. Plus support (helpline & leaflets) for prisoners and offenders families.

groups.name: Gingerbread
groups.desc: Support, advice, practical support and online forum for single parents.

groups.name: Grandparents Plus
groups.desc: Advice, support and information for grandparents and the wider family in children’s lives – especially when they take on the caring role in difficult family circumstances or have lost contact.

groups.name: NACOA (The National Association for the Children of Alcoholics)
groups.desc: Info, advice, support and message board for anyone affected by a parent’s drinking.

groups.name: Gamcare
groups.desc: Info, advice, support, counselling and chatrooms for problem gamblers and their families.

groups.name: CNWL National Problem Gambling Clinic (London, SW6)
groups.desc: Specialist NHS clinic for problem gamblers, offering brief interventions, psychological interventions and aftercare, via self-referral for problem gamblers and their families.

groups.name: Gamblers Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step Fellowship for problem gambling, forum, live chat, meetings, support and advice.

groups.name: Beaumont Society
groups.desc: Self-help organisation for the transgender community, their partners and families, including 24hr information line, online support group, magazine for members and social events.

groups.name: GIRES (Gender Identity Research & Education Society)
groups.desc: Directory of support groups for trans and gender non-conforming individuals.

groups.name: Help for Hoarders
groups.desc: Information, support, advice, forum discussions and awareness raising for hoarders and their loved ones plus links to other support websites under ‘resources’ tab

groups.name: Hoarding UK
groups.desc: Helpline, e-mail, advocacy, online and group support for those with hoarding problems.

groups.name: London Friend
groups.desc: Support for LGBT community, including counselling with sliding scale of fees, substance use (via Antidote) and domestic abuse plus support groups.

groups.name: Pink Practice, Holborn WC1
groups.desc: Counselling and psychotherapy project for individuals, couples and families, with a sliding scale of fees from £70 per session.

groups.name: Pink Therapy
groups.desc: Independent therapy organisation working with gender and sexual diversity clients, includes a ‘Find a Therapist’ service online.

groups.name: Action for Happiness
groups.desc: A movement of people committed to building a happier and more caring society, includes information, groups, Happy Cafes and online courses.

groups.name: Elefriends
groups.desc: A supportive online community where you can be yourself, listen, share and be heard, run by MIND, the Mental Health Charity.

groups.name: The Listening Place
groups.desc: Free face to face support in SW1 for those who feel suicidal. Contact via website for appointment.

groups.name: Living Life to the Full – CBT Skills Self Help website
groups.desc: A CBT life skills course teaching key knowledge in how to tackle and respond to issues/demands that we meet in our everyday lives.

groups.name: Living Well Network Hub (Lambeth)
groups.desc: Lambeth ‘front door’ to community based support for people’s mental health and wellbeing.

groups.name: The Maytree (Finsbury Park, N4)
groups.desc: Free respite centre with 4-5 night stay for those in suicidal crises.

groups.name: MIND
groups.desc: Bromley, Lewisham & Greenwich Mind supports residents experiencing any kind of mental distress by providing information, advice, support including 1:1 psychotherapy and groups.

groups.name: Mood Gym
groups.desc: An interactive self-help book to learn and practise skills to manage symptoms of depression and anxiety.

groups.name: Mood Juice
groups.desc: Internet based self-help resourcedesigned to help think about emotional problems and work towards solving them.

groups.name: Rethink
groups.desc: Advice and information across a range of issues (eg. welfare, carers rights, criminal justice), services and groups for people experiencing all mental health difficulties and their family and friends.

groups.name: Samaritans
groups.desc: Telephone to talk, round the clock,about whatever is getting to you.

groups.name: Sane Line
groups.desc: Emotional support and information to anyone affected by mental health problems through helpline (4.30 to 10.30pm), email services and online Support Forum.

groups.name: SlaM 24 Hour Mental Health Support Line
Solidarity in a Crises
groups.desc: Out-of-Hours Peer Support Service in Lambeth, providing crisis support over the phone or in person during the out of hours.

groups.name: SLaM Recovery College
groups.desc: Free workshops and courses to support living a meaningful and satisfying life for people who use SLaM services and those who support them.

groups.name: SupportLine
groups.desc: A confidential telephone helpline offering emotional support to any individual on any issue. The Helpline is primarily a preventative service and aims to support people before they reach the point of crisis. Particularly aimed at those who are socially isolated, vulnerable, at risk groups and victims of any form of abuse.

groups.name: Wheel of Well-Being
groups.desc: SLaM led web initiative to improve individual and community wellbeing with lots of tips and ideas in relation to: body, mind, spirit, people, place and planet.

groups.name: AA Alcoholics Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step mutual aid groups for alcohol problems.

groups.name: CA Cocaine Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step mutual aid groups for cocaine problems.

groups.name: Crystal Meth Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step mutual aid for crystal meth problems.

groups.name: Dual Diagnosis Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step mutual aid groups for people with substance use and mental health problems.

groups.name: MA Marijuana Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step mutual aid groups for marijuana problems.

groups.name: NA Narcotics Anonymous
groups.desc: 12 step mutual aid groups for drug problems

groups.name: SMART Recovery
groups.desc: Meetings and online forum for people with addictive behaviours and family/friends service

groups.name: Soberistas
groups.desc: Online community of women helping each other to live an alcohol free life. Create a profile for free or pay membership, around £3 a month to get full access to other resources online.

groups.name: BPD World
groups.desc: Information, advice, community forums, online and support worker service for anyone with a personality disorder, family and friends.

groups.name: BPAS British Pregnancy Advisory Service
groups.desc: Helpline support for reproductive choice by providing services to prevent or end unwanted pregnancy with contraception or abortion. Puts people in contact with their nearest consultation centre.

groups.name: Marie Stopes International
groups.desc: Abortion, vasectomy and counselling services.

groups.name: Miscarriage Association
groups.desc: Information, online and group support for people affected by the loss of a baby in pregnancy.

groups.name: National Childbirth Trust (NCT)
groups.desc: Information and support in pregnancy, childbirth and early parenthood, plus support services in local area.

groups.name: Albany Trust
groups.desc: Provides low cost therapy (sliding scale from £10) for LGBT individuals and couples around relationships.

groups.name: Institute of Family Therapy (London based)
groups.desc: Provides couple and family therapy service for those who are finding relationships problematic. Sliding scale of fees.  Also family mediation service for couples who are separating or divorcing.

groups.name: Relate
groups.desc: Relate offers advice, relationship counselling, sex therapy, workshops, mediation, consultations and support face-to-face, by phone and through this website.

groups.name: Free Mindfulness Project
groups.desc: Free guided mindfulness meditations to download and information about apps.

groups.name: Self Compassion
groups.desc: Website with information, resources, practices and research relating to self-compassion.

groups.name: Lifesigns
groups.desc: User led organisation providing information, alternative coping ideas, online support and forum for people affected by self-injury including family and friends.

groups.name: National Self Harm Network
groups.desc: 24 hour online forum for people who self-injure, as well as their family and friends.

groups.name: Recover Your Life
groups.desc: Information, advice and 24 hour online support community for people who self-harm.

groups.name: Scar Tissue
groups.desc: Fact sheet, resources and online forums for people who self-harm.

groups.name: Self Injury Support
groups.desc: List of national support groups, information and self-help ideas plus Women’s Self Injury Helpline 0808 800 8088 (not 24 hr) and text and email support 07537 432444 (not 24 hr)

groups.name: Dabs Pathfinder Service
groups.desc: A signposting service that provides free support, information and in house counselling to anyone regarding issues to do with childhood abuse, incest and sexual violence.

groups.name: The Havens (nearest Camberwell)
groups.phone: 020 3299 6900 for urgent advice/support if recently assaulted
groups.desc: For anyone who has been raped or sexually assaulted (women, men, children). Trained, experienced professionals give medical help and advice, counselling, practical emotional support, help with deciding whether to report crime to the Police, advice relating to pregnancy, sexually transmitted disease.

groups.name: MOSAC
groups.desc: Support for all non-abusing parents and carers whose children have been sexually abused including helpline, advice and advocacy. Interpretation available.

groups.name: NAPAC
groups.desc: National freephone support line for adults who have suffered any type of abuse in childhood. Plus local support group information and free legal advice.

groups.name: One in Four (London, SE6)
groups.desc: Counselling (from £16 for those receiving benefits), advocacy, groups, workshops and self-care (useful resources on website) for men and women who have experienced childhood sexual abuse and trauma.

groups.name: Rape Crisis South London
groups.desc: Comprehensive service for female survivors of sexual violence living anywhere in South London including 1:1 counselling (0208 683 3311) and group therapy (contribution as able).

groups.name: Survivors UK
groups.desc: 1:1 web or SMS or WhatsApp chat and counselling for men who have been raped or sexually abused. Support for those who have (or are considering) reporting to the police for emotional support, health, legal process and safety advice.

groups.name: Connect& Do
groups.desc: Social networking site to help build friends around shared interests in your local area.

groups.name: Meet Ups
groups.desc: Special interest and support groups in London.

groups.name: The Suzy Lamplugh Trust
groups.desc: The Helpline provides practical advice and information to anyone who is currently or previously been affected by harassment or stalking.

groups.name: Combat Stress
groups.desc: Helpline, free treatment and support for Veterans with mental health difficulties and their families.

groups.name: PTSD Resolution
groups.desc: Support to Veterans who have PTSD and their families.

groups.name: Victim Support
groups.desc: Information, support, understanding and forum for people who hear voices and those that support them, with a Find A Group service.

groups.name: Centre 70, London SE27
groups.desc: Free, confidential, independent, impartial advice (welfare benefits, housing, debt, consumer law, employment, utilities, general)by way of appointments, home visits and outreach.

groups.name: Turn 2 Us
groups.desc: Free service that helps people in financial need to access welfare benefits, charitable grants and other financial help – online, by phone and face to face.

groups.name: The Beth Centre
groups.desc: Supporting women who are at risk of or have been touched by the criminal justice system. Safe space with holistic one to one and group support around housing, welfare, education, employment, finances, substance misuse, health, parenting, court, leaving prison, exiting prostitution and domestic abuse.

groups.name: Hillcroft College (Surbiton, Surrey)
groups.desc: National residential college for women with free courses for those on benefits.

groups.name: Faces in Focus (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Low cost counselling service for young people age 11-25 for around £10 per session.

groups.name: The Mix
groups.desc: Information and support (Helpline and 1:2:1 Chat, group chat, counseling and Apps) across a range of issues: relationships, mental health, substance misuse, physical health, housing, money etc. for 13-25 year olds.

groups.name: The Well Centre (London, SE16)
groups.desc: Youth health centre (for ages 13-20) where you can see a youth worker, counsellor or doctor to discuss any health concerns or worries in a safe and confidential space.
